a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:07): "A few of the attributes are VERY popular with authors‚ÄîBorder, Width, Cellpadding, and Cellspacing are used in ~90% of all URLs that use tables."
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:09): Hixie: seems like making those non-conforming is an uphill battle
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:09): I don't see useful gain from it
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (13:11): is still incapable of remembering the CSS equivalents of cellpadding and cellspacing, and has to look it up every time he writes a table
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (13:13): 'border-spacing' and 'padding', I think
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (13:13): though I can't remember exactly what the cellpadding attribute does, so I could be wrong
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (13:15): yep, according to HTML4, it just adds padding to the cell, so: td { padding: 10px; } should be equivalent to cellpadding=10

3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (13:16): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: It's more like <style>#table-of-stuff td, #table-of-stuff th { padding: 10px; }</style><table id="table-of-stuff"> to be equivalent to <table cellpadding="10">
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (13:16): which is a big pain
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (13:17): yeah, I know. I just simplified it
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (13:17): Just thinking of ids for tables is a difficult task for me :-(
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (13:18): part of the problem with those attributes is that so many tools generate tables that contain those attributes by default.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (13:18): TextMate certainly does it when you use the insert table shortcut
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (13:22): To get the same effect as cellspacing=0, I think I have to something with border-collapse which gets all complicated and buggy
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (13:22): (I've hit the same border-collapse bug in Firefox on two entirely independent occasions)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (13:23): what border-collapse bug?
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (13:26): Something to do with rendering collapsed borders in tables with rowspans or something like that, but I don't remember exactly what it was now
0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (13:50): planet: Dev.Opera: Creating pseudo 3D games with HTML 5 canvas <http://dev.opera.com/articles/view/580>
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (13:53): Bah, Wolf3D is far too old-fashioned
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (13:53): People shouldn't accept anything less than Duke3D canvas raycasting!
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (13:54): (Maybe I should write an article about how to do that :-) )
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:10): real-time ray*tracing* FTW!
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:11): is raycasting another name for raytracing?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:12): or is it a different technique?
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (14:13): I believe you follow the rays the opposite direction
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:28): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: raytracing is *significantly* more compute-intensive and looks better
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:29): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, I understand what raytracing is. I'd never heard the term raycasting before

3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (14:37): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: Raycasting is (at least in the context of games) 2D - you cast a single ray per column of pixels, find the nearest object it hits, then draw that object in that column

3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (14:38): Raytracing is 3D, and uses lots more rays - you cast a single ray per pixel, find the nearest object it hits, and then cast a load more rays to do shadows and reflections and all the other fancy effects you want, and then finally you draw the pixel by combining all those rays
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (14:38): (I think a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9's statement was entirely wrong)
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (14:40): Anyway, real-time raytracing is a silly idea since you can get much better performance and much better control by hacking on polygon rasterisers :-)

3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (14:41): and you get photorealistic rendering by giving good tools to good artists who know how to cheat to make it look real, rather than by accurately modelling the physics of light
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:51): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: I see you changed some pattern names in the HTML5 schema recently
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:52): e.g., prose->flow
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:54): embedded->phrasing
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:54): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: yes. they now match the terminology of the spec
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:55): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: however, I removed .embedded, because that category from the spec is no longer relevant to document conformance
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:55): so the changes were
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:55): prose to flow
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:55): embedded to phrasing
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:55): phrase to phrasing
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:55): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: I also fixed the content model of audio and video
